Package com.simplifier.rules.read

Class ReadSimplifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simplifier.rules.read.ReadSimplifier
  • public class ReadSimplifier
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of methods that operate on the log: check if log contains redundant read action, and if so, remove them and return a new log.

    List of "Read" actions:
    • Chrome, copy
    • Excel, copyCell
    • Excel, copyRange

    Redundant cases:
    • If there is any number of actions between two "copy" actions except "paste" action, the first "copy" action is redundant. The case is described by redundantFirstCopyRegex.
      Example: 
                   "Chrome", "copy", "text"
             "Chrome", "editField", "text"
             "Chrome", "editField", "text"
             "Chrome", "copy", "text"
      First "copy" action is redundant.

    • If the log contains a single "copy" action and there is no "paste" action after it, the "copy" action is redundant. The case is described by singleCopyRegex.
      Example: 
                   "Chrome", "copy", "text"
             "Chrome", "editField", "text"
             "Chrome", "editField", "text"
      "copy" action is redundant.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.lang.String redundantFirstCopyRegex
      This is regular expression that corresponds to the case when there is any number of actions except "paste" action between two "copy" actions.
      private static java.lang.String singleCopyRegex
      This is a regular expression that corresponds to the case when the log contains a single "copy" action and there is no paste action after it.

    • Method Detail

      • containsRedundantCopy

        public static boolean containsRedundantCopy​(java.lang.String log)
        This method is used to check if the log contains a pattern that matches redundantFirstCopyRegex, i.e the log contains two "copy" actions, and there is any number of action between them except "paste" action.

        The method checks if the log contains a pattern that contains any number of actions except "paste" action between two "copy" actions.

        Parameters:
        log - the log that contains input actions.
        Returns:
        true if the log contains pattern that matches redundantFirstCopyRegex; false otherwise.

      • containsSingleCopy

        public static boolean containsSingleCopy​(java.lang.String log)
        This method is used to check if the log contains a pattern that matches singleCopyRegex, i.e the log contains a single "copy" action and there is no "paste" action after it.

        The method checks if the log contains a pattern that contains a single "copy" action and there is no "paste" action after it.

        Parameters:
        log - the log that contains input actions.
        Returns:
        true if the log matches singleCopyRegex. false otherwise.

      • removeRedundantCopy

        public static java.lang.String removeRedundantCopy​(java.lang.String log)
        This method is used to remove all redundant copy actions from the log.

        If the log contains pattern that matches redundantFirstCopyRegex, the method will remove first "copy" action in the pattern. The method will be called again if the log contains redundant "copy" action after replacing the pattern that matches redundantFirstCopyRegex until there are none of them.

        Parameters:
        log - the log that contains input actions.
        Returns:
        the log without redundant "copy" actions.

      • removeSingleCopy

        public static java.lang.String removeSingleCopy​(java.lang.String log)
        This method is used to remove all single "copy" actions from the log.

        If the log contains pattern that matches singleCopyRegex, the method will remove single "copy" action from the log.

        Parameters:
        log - the log that contains input actions.
        Returns:
        the log without single "copy" action.
